‚ùå Head to the GitHub repo Issues page for a current list. (This section will be removed in 22 rather than keep updating it.)
No phone number associated with contact.
A dial tone is a telephony signal used to indicate that the telephone exchange is working, has recognized an off-hook, and is ready to accept a call.

A ringback tone is an audible indication that is heard on the telephone line by the caller while the phone they are calling is being rung. It is normally a repeated tone, designed to assure the calling party that the called party\'s line is ringing, although the ring-back tone may be out of sync with the ringing signal.

An automatic callback on busy tone is an audible indication that the called party is currently busy, but they have enabled the automatic callback after hangup feature. If the calling party confirms their choice to be called back (by pressing a specific key), the callee phone will ring once they hangup, and the caller will then be called back.
Dial Tone - Send All Calls reminder
This dial tone signal is used to indicate to warn the user the Send All Calls function is still enabled on this phone line.
This dial tone signal is used to indicate that an unread message is waiting in the voicemail.
